head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden ¶ 31/3/65 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 29. inst. and to express to his Excellency the Governor my grateful appreciation of sending...

div.p: I265, unit 19, VPRS 1096 inward correspondence, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 4.10.93. To proof.
Melbourne bot. Garden

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 29. inst. and to express to his Excellency the Governor my grateful appreciation of sending me a copy of the Chevalier Biagi's letter of 20 march, conveying the Marquis Ridolphi's gratifications for some contributions made on behalf of this Government to scientific Institutions of the Italian Kingdom. I need scarcely add, that it will be a source of pleasure and instruction to me to maintain an uninterrupted communication with the Gentlemen of science in Italy and that such intercourse between countries of a similar clime cannot but tend to mutual advantage.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

div.p: Priv. Secr. to his Excellency Governor Sir Charl. Darling, K.C.B.
